poem:
Dream 'scapes

This autumn, the clocks soften like cheese,  
Dalí's mustache twirls in Figueres air.  
Europe whispers names: Breton, Magritte –  
history hangs on unfamiliar walls.  
Between Mallorca's sun and Sussex's cold shade,  
dreams unfurl their wings,  
tickling the corners of reality,  
until we all wake up,  
more intimate with our own strange depths.
